intro: Schivereckia bornmuelleri, commonly known as the dwarf bellflower, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soil, preferring cool and humid conditions. It has a compact growth habit with small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
